item.title: Kitaab launches its inaugural crowdfunding campaign
item.description:
Source: Kitaab website. Kitaab, meaning “book” in many Asian languages, is entering a new stage: crowdfunding on Indiegogo. Established in 2005, this literary initiative aims to empower Asian writers and connect them with a global audience. Founder and renowned author Zafar Anjum explains that Kitaab has successfully addressed a significant gap in the online Asian literary scene by creating a comprehensive, link-based repository of information focused on Asian writers and their work...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/kitaab-launches-its-inaugural-crowdfunding-campaign/

item.title: The Emirates Literature Foundation introduces a new digital discussion series
item.description:
The Emirates Literature Foundation has launched a new project, Literary Conversations Across Borders. This digital initiative aims to promote global cultural understanding by connecting Emirati writers and thinkers with internationally recognized experts for live discussions on significant issues. The series commences on May 30, 2020, with Indian politician and writer Shashi Tharoor and HE Zaki Nusseibeh, UAE Minister of State for the Office of Cultural Diplomacy. They will examine how the events of 2020 will shape the future, both positively and negatively...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-emirates-literature-foundation-introduces-a-new-digital-discussion-series/
